title.title: The Correspondence of John Hunt and Joshua Evans

msIdentifier.institution: Friends Historical Library of Swarthmore College

projectDesc.p: The correspondence of Quaker ministers John Hunt and Joshua Evans are stored at the Friends Historical Library of Swarthmore College. With the generous support of H. David and Joyce E. Hunt, Library staff scanned and transcribed these letters in 2023 and encoded the text in TEI. The 2023 project also included researching individuals mentioned in the text to create and update records about them in the Social Networks and Archival Context website

div.p: As I expect it would be agreeable to Joshua Evans’ wife and connections to have some account where he is, &c., & I thought I was willing to try to let them know, that he came across Susquehanna River from Deer-Creek with me last 7th day morning and attended our monthly meeting at East Nottingham that day, and next day our first day meeting which was a large gathering; yesterday he proposed being at Little Britain Meeting, another about 4 miles distant in the same township today, & tomorrow at West Nottingham. After that, his prospect seemed to be to go down to the eastern shore of Maryland by the Head of Sassafras, & to take the meetings, both on that shore, and the Delaware shore in succession, hoping to get nearly through them by the time of the Southern Quarterly Meeting, which begins the 25th of the 11th month. It appears he has been favored with remarkable health and success through this extensive journey as I think he told me he had not lain by even one day with sickness, if I remember right; also I understood his desire was to get home pretty soon after the Southern Quarter above hinted of, although I did not ask him particularly concerning that. I was with him at Deer-Creek monthly meeting before he came over the river, and both there and here I have had much unity with him & his honest, well-meant labors; particularly at our first day meeting, he being much favored there among a mixed multitude, to demonstrate (though not with the enticing words of man’s wisdom) that pure gospel doctrines, through the help of the spirit, may be preached with a degree of primitive force & energy, through simple instruments, who are called thereto, & submissively given up to be qualified for the purpose, by the effectual operation of the cross & mortification of all that is selfish & pleasing to the natural part. (Having given the above intimation as I heard Joshua express a desire to write himself if he knows of a direct opportunity)

closer.salute: I am with love to his connections their affectionate friend
